coverage: Zechariah spans dated night visions (chs. 1–8) and later apocalyptic oracles (chs. 9–14): temple restoration, Spirit-empowered leadership, angelic mediation, messianic Branch, shepherd parables, pierced-one mourning, living waters, and universal kingship. The corpus models people, groups, figures, and entities with intertexts and reception across Jewish and Christian traditions.
id_scheme: Cross-book stable by (type+primary-slug) + deterministic hash; alias reuse for shared entities.

entries: Zechariah son of Berechiah son of Iddo
All nations keeping Feast of Booths
Not by might but by Spirit
Delegation from Bethel asks about fasting
Ten men grasp the robe of a Jew
Blood of the covenant frees prisoners
Judah as bow, Ephraim as arrow
Wounds in the house of friends
Idolatry cut off from the land
Feast of Booths for all nations
Bells of horses: Holy to the LORD
Every pot holy to the LORD
Bells inscribed Holy to the LORD
Angelology: interpreting angel & Angel of the LORD
Pierced one in NT reception (John 19:37; Rev 1:7)
Living waters in NT & patristic baptism
Universal kingship (14:9) and Christ the King

entries.name: Zechariah son of Berechiah son of Iddo
entries.blurb: Prophet-priest of the early Persian period; name means ‘YHWH remembers,’ signaling covenant memory and restoration.

entries.name: Darius I (Persian king)
entries.blurb: Regnal framework (520–518 BCE) for night visions and fasting oracles.

entries.name: Joshua son of Jehozadak (high priest)
entries.blurb: High priest purified and re-clothed; later crowned as a memorial, foreshadowing priestly-messianic unity.

entries.name: Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel (governor)
entries.blurb: Davidic governor; mountain leveled before him; plumb line in hand as the capstone is set—not by might but by the Spirit.

entries.name: Angel of the LORD
entries.blurb: Mediating presence who intercedes for Jerusalem and rebukes the Accuser; identity debated in tradition.

entries.name: Interpreting Angel
entries.blurb: Guide who explains symbols, linking visions to temple restoration and future hope.

entries.name: Satan/Accuser
entries.blurb: Accuses Joshua until rebuked by the LORD; his limits underscore divine election.

entries.name: Good Shepherd
entries.blurb: Symbolic leader tending a flock doomed to slaughter, wielding the staves Favor and Union.

entries.name: Foolish Shepherd
entries.blurb: Satirical antitype who neglects the flock; a warning against predatory leadership.

entries.name: Worthless Shepherd
entries.blurb: Idol shepherd whose arm and eye are struck; epitomizes failed rule.

entries.name: House of David
entries.blurb: Lineage receiving outpoured spirit of grace and supplication; central in mourning and restoration.

entries.name: House of Levi/Shimei
entries.blurb: Priestly families named in the great mourning; signals comprehensive repentance.

entries.name: False prophets
entries.blurb: Shamed in the renewed community; wounds ‘in the house of friends’ expose false claims.

entries.name: Judah
entries.blurb: Covenant community restored and defended; Judah becomes God’s inheritance.

entries.name: Israel
entries.blurb: Broader covenant identity gathered into post-exilic hope.

entries.name: Remnant
entries.blurb: Returned and purified people whose hands are strengthened for the work.

entries.name: Nations
entries.blurb: From hostile besiegers to pilgrims keeping Sukkot; many join themselves to the LORD.

entries.name: North Country (Babylon)
entries.blurb: Place of exile; people called to flee and return to Zion.

entries.name: Philistia
entries.blurb: Judgment on coastal cities with promises of remnant inclusion.

entries.name: Ashkelon
entries.blurb: Philistine city that shall see and fear.

entries.name: Gaza
entries.blurb: Shall writhe in anguish under judgment.

entries.name: Ekron
entries.blurb: Her expectation shall be confounded.

entries.name: Ashdod
entries.blurb: A mixed people will dwell there; pride cut off.

entries.name: Tyre
entries.blurb: Wisdom and wealth judged; power consumed by fire.

entries.name: Sidon
entries.blurb: Partner to Tyre’s pride; under divine scrutiny.

entries.name: Greece (Javan)
entries.blurb: Foil in Judah’s eschatological warfare imagery.

entries.name: Egypt
entries.blurb: Subject to plague if refusing Sukkot pilgrimage.

entries.name: Assyria
entries.blurb: Exile lands named in return promises.

entries.name: Enemies gathered against Jerusalem
entries.blurb: Siege coalition ultimately shattered by divine intervention.

entries.name: All nations keeping Feast of Booths
entries.blurb: Global worshipers who annually ascend to celebrate Sukkot in Jerusalem.

entries.name: YHWH (the LORD)
entries.blurb: Indwelling fire-wall for Jerusalem, rebuker of the Accuser, and ultimate King over all the earth.

entries.name: Spirit of the LORD
entries.blurb: Empowers temple completion; the decisive force over human might.

entries.name: King over all the earth
entries.blurb: Climax of Zechariah’s vision: universal acknowledgment of the LORD’s kingship.

entries.name: Call to return
entries.blurb: Initial summons to repent and avoid the fate of the ancestors; sets the tone for the visions.

entries.name: Horsemen among the myrtles
entries.blurb: Scouts report earth’s quiet; the Angel intercedes for Jerusalem.

entries.name: Oracle of prosperity for Zion
entries.blurb: Return to Jerusalem with measuring line; cities overflow with prosperity.

entries.name: Four horns & four craftsmen
entries.blurb: Horns that scattered Judah are cast down by divinely raised smiths.

entries.name: Man with measuring line
entries.blurb: Jerusalem measured without walls—divine fire-wall and glory within.

entries.name: God’s zeal for Zion
entries.blurb: Declaration of jealous love and wrath against the at-ease nations.

entries.name: Joshua accused & cleansed
entries.blurb: High priest defended and purified; guilt removed in a single day.

entries.name: Filthy garments removed
entries.blurb: Symbolic removal of iniquity; transition to priestly fitness.

entries.name: Clean turban placed
entries.blurb: Installation act signifying restored priesthood.

entries.name: Stone with seven eyes
entries.blurb: Engraved stone under divine gaze; pledge of land-wide cleansing.

entries.name: Golden lampstand & two olive trees
entries.blurb: Temple light supplied by Spirit; governance and priesthood as olive-fed lamp.

entries.name: Two anointed ones
entries.blurb: Sons of oil standing by the Lord of all the earth—commonly linked to Zerubbabel and Joshua.

entries.name: Flying scroll (curse)
entries.blurb: Curse against thieves and perjurers; sin expelled from the community.

entries.name: Woman in the ephah (Wickedness)
entries.blurb: Personified Wickedness sealed and transported to Shinar.

entries.name: Four chariots from between mountains
entries.blurb: World-ranging patrols that quiet the Spirit in the north country.

entries.name: Zerubbabel and the plumb line
entries.blurb: Day of small things vindicated as capstone is set by Spirit-empowered hands.

entries.name: Not by might but by Spirit
entries.blurb: Mountain becomes a plain; grace over the capstone.

entries.name: Men of sign with Joshua
entries.blurb: Priestly entourage prefigures messianic Branch realities.

entries.name: Crowning of Joshua (memorial in temple)
entries.blurb: Silver and gold formed into a crown; set in the temple as a memorial of distant contributors and messianic hope.

entries.name: Branch (messianic)
entries.blurb: Shoots forth to build the temple; priestly and royal expectations converge.

entries.name: Delegation from Bethel asks about fasting
entries.blurb: Query sparks prophetic critique of performative fasting and call to justice.

entries.name: Fast of the fourth month
entries.blurb: One of the exile fasts destined to become a feast of joy and gladness.

entries.name: Fast of the fifth month
entries.blurb: Mourns temple destruction; transformed in restoration vision.

entries.name: Fast of the seventh month
entries.blurb: Commemorates Gedaliah’s assassination; turned to celebration.

entries.name: Fast of the tenth month
entries.blurb: Marks siege onset; future feast under peace and truth.

entries.name: Fasts turned to feasts
entries.blurb: Ethic of love for truth and peace undergirds the transformation.

entries.name: Love truth and peace
entries.blurb: Core exhortation replacing empty ritual with covenant justice.

entries.name: Ten men grasp the robe of a Jew
entries.blurb: Icon of nations seeking God with Israel—‘God is with you.’

entries.name: Blood of the covenant frees prisoners
entries.blurb: Pit prisoners released by covenant blood; new exodus imagery.

entries.name: Ask for rain (early/late)
entries.blurb: Seasonal provision from the LORD counters divination reliance.

entries.name: Idols and diviners condemned
entries.blurb: False guidance produces wandering; the LORD visits his flock.

entries.name: Judah as bow, Ephraim as arrow
entries.blurb: Unified northern-southern strength under divine warrior motif.

entries.name: King on a donkey
entries.blurb: Humble king establishes worldwide peace; NT echoes in the triumphal entry.

entries.name: Cornerstone/Peg/Bow of Judah
entries.blurb: Images of stability, security, and military strength arising from Judah.

entries.name: Two staves: Favor & Union
entries.blurb: Implements of covenant grace and national unity in shepherd parable.

entries.name: Breaking the staff Favor
entries.blurb: Symbolic annulling of covenant with the peoples.

entries.name: Breaking the staff Union
entries.blurb: Symbolic sundering between Judah and Israel.

entries.name: Thirty pieces of silver (potter/treasury)
entries.note: Textual traditions vary (potter vs. treasury). NT reception applies to Judas’ payment.
entries.blurb: Despised wage thrown into the house of the LORD for the potter/treasury.

entries.name: Pierced one
entries.blurb: Spirit of grace leads to national mourning over the one they pierced; NT and apocalyptic echoes.

entries.name: Cleansing fountain opened
entries.blurb: Ever-flowing source for sin and impurity; sacramental overtones in later reception.

entries.name: Wounds in the house of friends
entries.blurb: Ambiguous wounds unmask false prophecy and misdirected loyalties.

entries.name: False prophets ashamed
entries.blurb: Parents enforce truth; hairy mantle abandoned as disguises fall.

entries.name: Idolatry cut off from the land
entries.blurb: Names of idols removed; unclean spirit banished.

entries.name: Strike the shepherd
entries.blurb: Sword against the shepherd; flock scattered—later cited in the Gospels.

entries.name: Living waters from Jerusalem
entries.blurb: Perennial streams to east and west; life sourced from the holy city.

entries.name: Day of the LORD (final siege)
entries.blurb: A day when nations gather, the city is taken, and the LORD fights.

entries.name: Mount of Olives split
entries.blurb: Earth-shattering escape route; the LORD arrives with holy ones.

entries.name: Jerusalem raised and secure
entries.blurb: Topography reshaped; the city inhabited in safety.

entries.name: Plague on nations (flesh/eyes/tongue)
entries.blurb: Unique wasting plague strikes besieging nations and their beasts.

entries.name: Feast of Booths for all nations
entries.blurb: Annual Sukkot pilgrimage mandated; drought for noncompliance.

entries.name: Bells of horses: Holy to the LORD
entries.blurb: Everyday implements bear priestly inscription—expanded holiness.

entries.name: Every pot holy to the LORD
entries.blurb: Common cookware equals temple bowls; total consecration envisioned.

entries.name: Temple
entries.blurb: Axis of restoration in visions and messianic building promises.

entries.name: Altar
entries.blurb: Implied sacrificial locus within restored worship.

entries.name: Holy Mountain
entries.blurb: Zion renamed City of Truth; mountain of the LORD of hosts.

entries.name: Jerusalem
entries.blurb: From unwalled community under divine fire-wall to eschatological center of life.

entries.name: Zion
entries.blurb: Object of divine zeal; home of truth and peace.

entries.name: Measuring line
entries.blurb: Instrument of planning signaling expansion and divine protection.

entries.name: Plumb line
entries.blurb: Precision tool in Zerubbabel’s hand—capstone grace.

entries.name: Lampstand
entries.blurb: Seven-branched light fed by oil; symbolizes Spirit-sustained witness.

entries.name: Olive trees
entries.blurb: Twin sources supplying oil to the lampstand; linked to anointed leaders.

entries.name: Olive oil
entries.blurb: Flow of Spirit-mediated supply for the lampstand.

entries.name: Stone with seven eyes (stone)
entries.blurb: Observed and engraved stone in priestly vision; token of swift cleansing.

entries.name: Colored horses
entries.blurb: Red, sorrel, white—later chariot teams patrolling the earth.

entries.name: Ephah basket
entries.blurb: Measuring container bearing Wickedness away to Shinar.

entries.name: Wickedness (sealed with lead)
entries.blurb: Contained by a lead cover; removed from the land.

entries.name: Mountains of bronze
entries.blurb: Portal for chariots, evoking stability and grandeur.

entries.name: Silver & gold crown(s)
entries.blurb: Crafted from diaspora gifts; associated with Joshua and temple memorial.

entries.name: Treasury/Temple memorial
entries.blurb: Placement of crown(s) as a lasting reminder in the house of the LORD.

entries.name: Fast days set
entries.blurb: Fourth, fifth, seventh, tenth months marked for mourning in exile.

entries.name: Feasts of joy
entries.blurb: Transformed observances characterized by joy and gladness.

entries.name: Donkey colt
entries.blurb: Beast of humble entry for Zion’s king.

entries.name: Cornerstone
entries.blurb: Foundation of communal stability re-emerging from Judah.

entries.name: Tent peg
entries.blurb: Image of fixedness and reliability in leadership.

entries.name: Battle bow
entries.blurb: Military capacity under divine leadership.

entries.name: Staff Favor
entries.blurb: Instrument representing covenant grace.

entries.name: Staff Union
entries.blurb: Instrument representing national unity.

entries.name: Thirty pieces of silver
entries.blurb: Contemptuous wage thrown into the house of the LORD.

entries.name: Fountain for cleansing
entries.blurb: Perennial resource cleansing sin and impurity for the house of David and inhabitants of Jerusalem.

entries.name: Sword
entries.blurb: Weapon raised against the shepherd—divine decree in the parable.

entries.name: Mount of Olives
entries.blurb: Eastern ridge split in the eschatological quake.

entries.name: Living waters
entries.blurb: Streams flow summer and winter; life proceeds from the city.

entries.name: Plague imagery
entries.blurb: Graphic wasting of besiegers; extends to animals and plunderers.

entries.name: Feast of Booths (Sukkot)
entries.blurb: Feast universalized; attendance marks allegiance to the King.

entries.name: Bells inscribed Holy to the LORD
entries.blurb: Inscription formerly on priestly plate now adorns mundane gear.

entries.name: Holy pots and bowls
entries.blurb: Common cookware elevated to temple-grade holiness.

entries.name: Lebanon cedars
entries.blurb: Majestic trees felled in lament over leadership collapse.

entries.name: Bashan oaks
entries.blurb: Strength imagery turned to mourning under judgment.

entries.name: Jordan thickets
entries.blurb: Lion’s haunt echoes; shepherds wail as glory is ruined.

entries.name: Shepherded flock doomed to slaughter
entries.blurb: People under corrupt leadership, subject of shepherd parable and covenant acts.

entries.name: YHWH remembers (prophet’s name meaning)
entries.blurb: Name functions as theological thesis: divine remembrance drives restoration.

entries.name: Priestly lineage of Zechariah (Iddo family)
entries.blurb: Priestly roots frame temple-centric visions and concerns.

entries.name: Alongside Haggai (Ezra 5–6 link)
entries.blurb: Prophetic tandem credited with advancing temple completion under Persian decrees.

entries.name: Angelology: interpreting angel & Angel of the LORD
entries.blurb: Mediatorial and intercessory roles structure the visionary experience.

entries.name: Satan/Accuser bounded by YHWH
entries.blurb: Divine rebuke limits accusation; election and cleansing prevail.

entries.name: Branch theology (3:8; 6:12)
entries.blurb: Priestly-royal figure who builds the temple and bears majesty; typology blossoms in later reception.

entries.name: Spirit empowerment over might (4:6)
entries.blurb: Central axiom for post-exilic work and later Christian spirituality.

entries.name: Temple completion as eschatological sign
entries.blurb: Building project recast as down payment on future glory and universal worship.

entries.name: Fasting to feasting (8:19)
entries.blurb: Ritual mourning transfigured by ethical renewal and communal joy.

entries.name: Shepherd motif cluster (John 10; Matt 26:31)
entries.blurb: From parabolic shepherds to stricken shepherd, the motif funnels into NT Christology.

entries.name: Pierced one in NT reception (John 19:37; Rev 1:7)
entries.blurb: Mourning over the pierced becomes a lens for the passion and parousia.

entries.name: Thirty pieces in NT reception (Matt 27:9–10)
entries.blurb: Evangelists weave Zechariah’s pricing and temple-potter imagery into Judas traditions.

entries.name: Living waters in NT & patristic baptism
entries.blurb: Streams from Jerusalem inform baptismal and eschatological imagery.

entries.name: Universal kingship (14:9) and Christ the King
entries.blurb: Liturgical appropriation of divine kingship consummation.

entries.name: Holy pots/horses bells: total sanctification
entries.blurb: Abolishes sacred/secular split; the ordinary bears holiness.

entries.name: Qumran/Second Temple apocalyptic reception
entries.blurb: Zechariah’s visions and Branch figure echo in sectarian and apocalyptic literature.

entries.name: Jewish liturgy: Zech 14 & Sukkot
entries.blurb: Readings on Sukkot highlight universal pilgrimage and kingship themes.
